case_vignette:
A 6-year-old girl presents with a 1-year history of a waxing and waning rash on her limbs and face. The rash starts as red scaly bumps that fade over several weeks leaving smooth white spots. Every few months, the patient gets several new red bumps. The rash is not itchy or painful. Her parents have tried topical steroid creams that did not help clear the rash. Examination reveals scattered erythematous scaly papules on both legs and several hypopigmented macules on her legs, arms, and face. The patient's mother is concerned that the rash is a sign of a serious underlying condition.

Original text:
A 6-year-old boy presents with a 1-year history of a waxing and waning rash on his limbs and face. The rash starts as red scaly bumps that fade over several weeks leaving smooth white spots. Every few months, the patient gets several new red bumps. The rash is not itchy or painful. His parents have tried topical steroid creams that did not help clear the rash. Examination reveals scattered erythematous scaly papules on both legs and several hypopigmented macules on his legs, arms, and face. The patient's father is concerned that the rash is a sign of a serious underlying condition.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on my limbs and face that starts as red scaly bumps and fades leaving smooth white spots.
How long have you had this rash?
I have had the rash for about a year.
Does the rash itch or cause any pain?
No, the rash does not itch or cause any pain.
Have you experienced any similar skin issues in the past?
No, I have not experienced similar skin issues in the past.
Do you have any known allergies or chronic health conditions?
No, I don't have any known allergies or chronic health conditions.
Has anyone in your family had similar skin issues or any other skin conditions?
The information provided does not mention any family history of similar skin issues or other skin conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Pityriasis alba
